alert.note: Alert for Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 11:51AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Crawford, northwestern Sebastian and southeastern Sequoyah Counties through 1215 PM CDT... At 1151 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Roland, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Alma... Muldrow... Roland... Mulberry... Dyer... Chester... Moffett... Rudy... Lake Fort Smith... Figure Five... Concord... Shibley... Mill Creek... Cottonwood... Dora... Furry... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 21. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 320 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 8. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
